articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Palestinian militant group Hamas will likely replace Yahya Sinwar with a new political leader based outside Gaza while his brother - Mohammad Sinwar - is expected to assume a bigger role directing the war against Israel in the territory, experts say.
articles.title: Hamas likely to name new leader from outside Gaza after Sinwar's death

articles.author: Bianca Flowers, Disha Raychaudhuri
articles.description: Francisca Shaw said she knew something was deeply wrong as she was rushed into an emergency cesarean for the delivery of her third child, a daughter, at Seattle's University of Washington Medical Center in 2015.
articles.title: Black women face a maternal health crisis. Advocates want to make that a US election issue.

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Friday it sent another army unit to support its forces operating in Jabalia, the largest of Gaza's eight historic refugee camps, where residents said tanks blew up roads and houses as they thrust further into the territory.
articles.title: Israel sends more troops into north Gaza, deepens raid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Italian coastguard vessel collected migrants held in reception centres in Albania on Saturday to transfer them to Italy, after a court ruling dealt a blow to Rome's plans to house migrants picked up at sea outside the EU.
articles.title: Italian coastguard vessel picks up migrants from Albania to transfer them to Italy

articles.author: Dave Sherwood, Marianna Parraga
articles.description: Cuba's national electrical grid shut down on Friday after one of the island's major power plants failed, Cuba's energy ministry said, plunging the entire country into a blackout.
articles.title: Cuba's power grid fails, plunging country into darkness

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France's foreign minister said Paris was open to the idea of an immediate invitation for Ukraine to join NATO, but that talks would continue on the subject with allies.
articles.title: France open to immediate Ukraine NATO invite, but more talks needed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gunmen killed a Mozambique opposition lawyer and a party official after firing multiple rounds at a car in which they were travelling on Saturday, ratcheting up tensions ahead of protests against a disputed election result, rights groups said.
articles.title: Gunmen kill two Mozambique opposition figures ahead of election protests

articles.author: Angelo Amante
articles.description: The global security framework is growing increasingly precarious due to competing world visions, Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto told his peers at a meeting of the Group of Seven wealthy democracies that kicked off in Naples on Saturday.
articles.title: Italy defence minister warns G7 over 'deteriorated' security framework

articles.author: Casey Hall
articles.description: British Foreign Secretary David Lammy said on Saturday that businesses wanted "stability and clarity" in trade with China, as London seeks to reset relations with Beijing under the new Labour government.
articles.title: UK foreign secretary pledges 'consistency' in relations with China

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump are barreling through the battleground state of Michigan on Friday, where opinion polls show the U.S. presidential candidates are essentially tied just 18 days before the Nov. 5 election.
articles.title: Harris, Trump barnstorm in Michigan, where polls are tied
